channel.title: Comments on: #DatPostmil? #3: The Postmillennial Doctrine of Bifurcationâ€”Two ages in the Gospel Age?

item.title: By: Clyde Pilgrim
item.dc:creator: Clyde Pilgrim
item.description: Because our Creator has placed eternity in the hearts of fallen humanity, most, if not all of us, naturally crave a utopian kingdom before the second coming of Christ. Actually OT Israel and the NT Israel (church) expected a glorious kingdom of righteousness, prosperity, peace and unity at the first coming of Christ. Matt. 16:22-23; 26:51-54 Acts 1:6-8;
item.content:encoded: Because our Creator has placed eternity in the hearts of fallen humanity, most, if not all of us, naturally crave a utopian kingdom before the second coming of Christ. Actually OT Israel and the NT Israel (church) expected a glorious kingdom of righteousness, prosperity, peace and unity at the first coming of Christ. Matt. 16:22-23; 26:51-54 Acts 1:6-8;

item.title: By: Clyde Pilgrim
item.dc:creator: Clyde Pilgrim
item.description: Thanks to God and to you Pr. Waldron for your great contribution to the universal church and its preparation for the loosing of satan and the full manifestation of the Antichrist before the appearance of Christ in glory. The characteristics and timing of the mediatorial kingdom of Christ has serious practical implications and applications for the church militant.
item.content:encoded: Thanks to God and to you Pr. Waldron for your great contribution to the universal church and its preparation for the loosing of satan and the full manifestation of the Antichrist before the appearance of Christ in glory. The characteristics and timing of the mediatorial kingdom of Christ has serious practical implications and applications for the church militant.

item.title: By: Brad Bridgman
item.dc:creator: Brad Bridgman
item.description: Thank you for this series! It has been extremely helpful and clarifying.
item.content:encoded: Thank you for this series! It has been extremely helpful and clarifying.
